messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Sure—when you say “later,” do you mean the rest of today, sometime in the next few days, or just any upcoming reminder in the future? Let me know so I can pull up the right items.
Sure—so I can pull everything that’s still ahead of you today, could you tell me roughly what time it is for you right now (or your time-zone)?
Not too sure of the time at the moment.

No problem. To make sure I only show things that are still ahead of you today, could you let me know what time-zone you’re in (or roughly where you are)? That way I can line up your reminders with your local “today.”
Sorry, I don't have that info right now.

No worries—time-of-day can matter for deciding what still counts as “later today.” If you’re not sure of your local time or time-zone, would you like me to:

• Show every reminder you have dated for “today” (regardless of whether the time might already have passed), or  
• Assume the system’s default time-zone (UTC) and show only reminders whose due time is still ahead of the present moment in that zone?

Just let me know which approach works for you (or, if you prefer a different way, tell me).
